cards.name: Eirath Core Lore
cards.description: Immutable world foundations: races, cultures, cosmology.

Human.culture: Diverse city-states; festivals mark trade seasons.

Elf.culture: Art bound to memory; monarchs age rapidly, shaping succession myths.

Dwarf.culture: Guild clans; oaths carry legal weight across holds.

Dragonborn.culture: Clan creeds; ancestral breathlines honored in rites.

Gnome.culture: Workshops under willows; inventions double as folk art.

Half-Elf.culture: Go-betweens in courts; multilingual diplomacy traditions.

Half-Orc.culture: Warband codes turned civic charters in frontier towns.

Tiefling.culture: Diasporic enclaves; reputations negotiated via favor-debts.

skill.description: Ryze demonstrated the ability to cast a spell like 'Bird Sight' to gain an aerial perspective, revealing a hidden path through the treacherous Shattered Shoals. This suggests a background in arcane navigation or magical exploration, likely honed in environments where traditional maps and tools were unreliable or unavailable. His skill not only saved the crew but also revealed his value to them, despite their initial hostility.

cards.name: The Tide
cards.description: A secretive and feared cult or faction centered around sea pacts, maritime power, and ancient maritime traditions. Their influence is marked by specific seals and symbols, and they are known to be both revered and feared by sailors and pirates alike.

data.influence: maritime regions, pirate crews, coastal cities
data.reputation: feared and respected, associated with both protection and danger
goals: expansion of influence through pacts and alliances

cards.name: Jask
cards.description: First mate of the Sable Gull, a grizzled human with a scar running down one side of his face. Ruthless but pragmatic, he values competence and survival above all else.

relationships.Veyla: trusts her leadership but questions her risks
relationships.Ryze: initially hostile but now grudgingly respectful after Ryze proved his skill

goals: uncover the truth about the map fragment

cards.name: Veyla
cards.description: Captain of the Sable Gull, a sharp-witted and authoritative human woman with a reputation for daring runs through dangerous waters. She is marked by the Tide but plays her cards close to her chest.

relationships.Jask: relies on his pragmatism but keeps him at arm's length
relationships.Ryze: intrigued by his arcane skills and ignorance of the Tide, sees potential in him

goals: uncover the secrets of the map fragment

cards.name: Sable Gull: Trust and the Tide
cards.description: A moment of confrontation and revelation as Ryze challenges the crew's loyalty and intentions, exposing his own distrust and the fragile balance of trust aboard the Sable Gull.

keyMoments: Ryze questions the crew's trust in him
Jask's hostility shifts to grudging respect
consequences: The crew's perception of Ryze shifts from outsider to potential ally
Veyla's authority is reinforced but her secrets are now under scrutiny
The tension between survival and loyalty is highlighted
